title: ovarian follicular - good group1
extract_protocol_ch1: Ovarian follicular fluid was collected by transvaginal ultrasound-guided puncture. Immediately after oocytes were retrieved, follicular fluid was collected and processed to remove the blood. Follicular fluid was then centrifuged at 2000g for 10 min to collect the supernatant, and the supernatant was centrifuged twice at 100,000g for 70 min to pellet exosomes.
extract_protocol_ch1.1: MicroRNA libraries were prepared using the TruSeq Small RNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA, USA) following the manufacturer’s instructions. Briefly, small RNAs were ligated with 3’ and 5’ adapters, followed by reverse transcription to produce single stranded cDNAs. The cDNAs were amplified by PCR in 11 cycles.
data_processing: Raw data reads were trimmed by cutadapter in order to receive clean data reads.
data_processing.1: Clean reads were blasted to blasted in miRNA database, RFam database and Repbase database to remove repeats, non-miRNA families and other low quality sequences. Then aligned to human genome GRCH37.
data_processing.2: Reads count data was received from alignment result, then differential expression analysis was conducted on the basis of it.
contact_institute: Center for Reproductive medicine, Shanghai Tenth People’s Hospital of Tongji University
